exercise: message = 'INSERTED'. Use the .format() method to print 'This is a string INSERTED'.
name = 'Alice'. Use the .format() method to print 'My name is Alice'.
language = 'Python'. Use the .format() method to print 'I am learning Python'.
age = 25. Use the .format() method to print 'I am 25 years old'.
city = 'New York'. Use the .format() method to print 'I live in New York'.
fruit = 'apple'. Use the .format() method to print 'My favorite fruit is apple'.
first = 'Hello'. second = 'World'. Use the .format() method to print 'Hello World'.
value = 10. Use the .format() method to print 'The value is 10'.
color = 'blue'. Use the .format() method to print 'The sky is blue'.
a = 5. b = 10. Use the .format() method to print 'The sum of 5 and 10 is 15'.
x = 'fox'. y = 'brown'. z = 'quick'. Use the .format() method with numbered placeholders to print 'The quick brown fox'.
a = 'Python'. b = 'fun'. c = 'is'. Use the .format() method with numbered placeholders to print 'Python is fun'.
f = 'fox'. b = 'brown'. q = 'quick'. Use the .format() method with keyword arguments to print 'The quick brown fox'.
first_name = 'John'. last_name = 'Doe'. Use the .format() method to print 'My name is John Doe'.
item = 'book'. price = 19.99. Use the .format() method to print 'The book costs $19.99'.
a = 10. b = 3. Calculate a/b and use the .format() method to print the result with 2 decimal places.
pi = 3.14159. Use the .format() method to display pi with 3 decimal places.
result = 2/3. Use the .format() method to display the result with 4 decimal places.
temperature = 98.6. Use the .format() method to print 'Body temperature is 98.60 degrees'.
result = 0.5. Use the .format() method to print the result in a field width of 10 characters with 1 decimal place.
num1 = 1. num2 = 2. num3 = 3. Use the .format() method with numbered placeholders to print them in reverse order.
value = 123.456789. Use the .format() method to display the value with various precisions (1, 2, and 3 decimal places) in the same print statement.
student = 'Alice'. score = 95. grade = 'A'. Use the .format() method to print 'Student: Alice, Score: 95, Grade: A'.
value = 0.5. Use the .format() method to print the value with a field width of 10 characters, right-aligned with 2 decimal places.
amount = 1234.56. Use the .format() method to format as currency with commas and 2 decimal places (e.g., '$1,234.56').
percentage = 0.8523. Use the .format() method to display this as a percentage with 1 decimal place (e.g., '85.2%').
a = 100. b = 200. c = 300. Create a table-like output with right-aligned numbers using the .format() method.
name = 'Bob'. age = 30. job = 'Developer'. Format a string that repeats these values in different orders using the .format() method.
product = 'Laptop'. inventory = 5. price = 899.99. Use the .format() method to create an inventory report string.
small = 1.23456. medium = 12.3456. large = 123.456. Use the .format() method to align these decimals by their decimal points.
